content.title: Neurogenic TOS
content.definition: Most common form (95%). Brachial plexus compression causing pain, paresthesias, weakness. Diagnosis often challenging.
content.statement: Neurogenic TOS is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Thoracic-Outlet-Syndrome that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Neurogenic TOS helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Neurogenic TOS include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Neurogenic TOS.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
